brief: Bubble risk is high as valuation, concentration, and liquidity indicators remain elevated.

indicators.name: Valuations vs History
indicators.description: Equity valuations remain well above long-term historical averages.

indicators.name: Market Concentration
indicators.description: A small number of mega-cap stocks account for a disproportionate share of market returns.

indicators.name: Equity Risk Premium
indicators.description: Investors are receiving historically low compensation for taking equity risk.

indicators.name: Speculative Activity
indicators.description: IPO issuance and retail trading activity remain active but uneven.

indicators.name: IPO & Profitless Growth
indicators.description: Increased investor appetite for unprofitable growth companies.

indicators.name: Retail Leverage & Options
indicators.description: Retail participation and options usage suggest increasing leverage sensitivity.

indicators.name: Liquidity Conditions
indicators.description: Financial conditions have tightened while risk assets remain elevated.

indicators.name: Credit Spreads
indicators.description: Credit spreads remain narrow, signaling limited perceived risk.

indicators.name: Yield Curve Stress
indicators.description: Yield curve dynamics indicate elevated recession and repricing risk.
